intro: Stapeliopsis ballyi, commonly known as the Bally's milkweed, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among species in its family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring minimal water and well-draining soil. Stapeliopsis ballyi is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
